<td style="padding-top:20px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Fifty years ago today, the world got a little smaller when the Magic Kingdom first opened at Disney World in Florida. We’re going to dive deeper into the anniversary in the Sunday Edition, but here are three interesting stats to tide you over:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Admission in 1971 was $3.50 for adults and $1 for children. It's $109 now.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The FAA has designated Disney World a “no-fly zone,” a level of security typically afforded to places like the White House and NASA’s Kennedy Space Center.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney’s bus fleet is the third largest fleet of any Florida transportation system.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, be our guest, put our newsletter service to the test.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch</em><br></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/government-shutdown-averted-but-big-battles-loom-for-biden-s-agenda?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Congress Is in the Tightest Pennant Race of All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/government-shutdown-averted-but-big-battles-loom-for-biden-s-agenda?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Capitol Hill illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2a6f770af9886e096d1dd90ee86e4cdde8f00cac-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Wednesday night, Republicans edged the Democrats 13–12 in a nail-biter of a Congressional Baseball Game.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nail-biting was the theme of the week on Capitol Hill, as lawmakers grappled over a slew of bills that will define President Biden’s economic agenda. Here’s where things stand, going from easiest to resolve to messiest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Government shutdown: </strong>It was avoided with hours to spare. Biden signed a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/congress-moves-to-avert-partial-government-shutdown-8f5b5b0c6c4cb12af8316ffc0b098771?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stopgap spending bill</a> that extends government spending through Dec. 3, when Congress will have to figure out another short- or long-term solution. This bill also includes billions of dollars for Afghan refugee resettlement and aid for communities hit by recent hurricanes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Debt ceiling: </strong>Congress has until Oct. 18 to suspend or raise the debt ceiling before the US begins defaulting on its loans, an outcome that would likely be catastrophic for the economy. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is planning a vote on the debt ceiling as soon as <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-30/schumer-escalates-pressure-on-debt-limit-plans-vote-next-week?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">next week</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For her part, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen never wants to hear the word “debt ceiling” again—yesterday she told lawmakers the US should abolish the concept of a borrowing limit. Or maybe she could just <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/24/the-legend-of-the-usd1-trillion-platinum-coin?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mint the coin</a>?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Infrastructure: </strong>hold in case of vote</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$3.5 trillion spending bill: </strong>It’s stuck in the mud as Democrats have struggled to round up support for their package that would pour unprecedented sums into health care, education, and climate. Republicans oppose the plan due to the cost...but the bigger issue is winning over some centrist Democrats, who are also holding out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Joe Manchin said yesterday his top-line cost for the plan would be <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/30/politics/manchin-bipartisan-infrastructure-deal-vote-negotiations/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.5 trillion</a>, less than half of the original price tag. Without the entire party rallying behind it, the package can’t pass the Senate, where the Dems have the slimmest of majorities.</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/blue-origin-employees-open-letter-toxic-workplace?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Blue Origin Accused of Running a Sexist Ship
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/blue-origin-employees-open-letter-toxic-workplace?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jeff Bezos " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/29b4b2e449c9d18134236c54d220ef2a79e7ab84-1024x708.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">21 current and former employees of Jeff Bezos’s space company, Blue Origin, published an <a href="https://www.lioness.co/post/bezos-wants-to-create-a-better-future-in-space-his-company-blue-origin-is-stuck-in-a-toxic-past?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open letter</a> on Thursday describing it as a “toxic” workplace “rife with sexism.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spearheaded by Blue Origin’s former head of employee communications, Alexandra Abrams, the letter alleges that the company is dismissive of safety concerns, creates a sexist environment for female employees, and stifles professional dissent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The signatories allege that an executive who was repeatedly reported for sexual harassment was given a position on a hiring committee for an HR role. They also wrote that another former male executive would inquire about female employees’ dating lives, referring to them as “baby doll” or “baby girl.” The behavior was so well known, the letter claims, that some women at the company would warn new female hires to stay away from the executive (who, according to the letter, had a close personal relationship with Jeff Bezos).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response to the allegations, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/30/jeff-bezos-blue-origin-essay-claims-toxic-workplace.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Blue Origin’s VP of communications</a> stated that Abrams was “dismissed for cause” in 2019, and that “Blue Origin has no tolerance for discrimination or harassment of any kind.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An FAA spokesperson said that the agency will <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/faa-review-safety-concerns-raised-by-former-blue-origin-employee-2021-09-3?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">review the concerns</a> raised in the letter. —<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/whats-once-a-month-and-too-damn-high?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's Once a Month and Too Damn High?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/whats-once-a-month-and-too-damn-high?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The outside of a brick apartment building in Brooklyn, NY." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1b65e24aed339a364e5ab536ab87fb21fd152ab4-1920x1280.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pandemic discount, we hardly knew ye—rental prices in the US are skyrocketing. The median national rent for a one-bedroom apartment is up 10.7% from March 2020, while two-bedrooms are up 13%, according to the <a href="https://www.zumper.com/blog/rental-price-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Zumper National Rent Report</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Double digit increases are…not common. For context, 2020 rents increased <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/rent-prices-increasing-us-cities-zumper-data-2021-9?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1% from the previous year</a>, and 2019 rents were stagnant compared to 2018. It’s a “shocking level of growth, especially considering the vast majority of it has come in the last nine months,” wrote Jeff Andrews, the author of the report.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why the surge? </strong>To put it simply, <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/rents-increasing-new-york-phoenix-greenwich-single-family-homes-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">demand is back</a>. Gen Z renters are moving out of their childhood homes after a long pandemic, remote-working millennials are picking apartments in more affordable cities, and baby boomers are offloading their homes in a seller’s market, opting for rentals instead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pour one out for renters in...</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Phoenix, where the one-bedroom median rent increased 24.8% between January and September.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>New York City, where some rents have </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-15/new-york-city-rents-landlords-jack-up-prices-70-in-lease-renewals-post-covid?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 70%</a></span><span> since the dog days of the pandemic.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>MK</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><br></p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Honestly, it looks a lot like <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/beam/secrets-of-a-startup-founder" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the daily schedule of wellness brand Beam’s co-founder, Matt Lombardi</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He gave us an <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/beam/secrets-of-a-startup-founder" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exclusive look</a> at how he spends his day—and how he uses Beam to stay energized, focused, and well-rested. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We learned that being a startup founder is more than just picking out eye-catching logos and deciding whether it will be Taco Tuesday or Taco Thursday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/beam/secrets-of-a-startup-founder" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lombardi structures his day</a> with intention, asks tough questions of his team, and gives himself the space to focus. Plus, he was an NHL player, which is certainly an asset to someone who is running a team of high-achievers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bottom line: Starting a start up is just the beginning. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/beam/secrets-of-a-startup-founder" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Take a look at our latest interactive article with Beam to see what it really takes to run and GROW one right here</a>.</p>
</td>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/key-performance-indicators-october-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><br>Stat: </strong>Teens—they <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-science-health-tobacco-industry-regulation-42c74433853293af2ea65caa10e9cb7e?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just aren’t vaping</a> like they used to. 11% of high schoolers and less than 3% of middle schoolers said they used e-cigs or vapes recently, a ~40% drop from last year...which itself was a big drop from 2019. Experts say school closures contributed to lower vaping rates, since it’s such a social activity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"Will you commit to ending Finsta?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This was a <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1443646297064439808?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">perplexing question</a> Sen. Richard Blumenthal asked Facebook’s global head of safety, Antigone Davis, during a Congressional hearing about the company’s impact on teens’ mental health. Finsta is short for “Fake Instagram,” a second account some users make; it’s not a FB product.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>New research shows insider trading is everywhere. (<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-09-29/is-stock-market-rigged-insider-trading-by-executives-is-pervasive-critics-say?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg Businessweek</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

padding-bottom: 5px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGOVERNMENT \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/government-shutdown-averted-but-big-battles-loom-for-biden-s-agenda?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCongress Is in the Tightest Pennant Race of All \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/government-shutdown-averted-but-big-battles-loom-for-biden-s-agenda?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Capitol Hill illustration \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2a6f770af9886e096d1dd90ee86e4cdde8f00cac-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Wednesday night, Republicans edged the Democrats 13–12 in a nail-biter of a Congressional Baseball Game.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNail-biting was the theme of the week on Capitol Hill, as lawmakers grappled over a slew of bills that will define President Biden’s economic agenda. Here’s where things stand, going from easiest to resolve to messiest.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment shutdown: \u003c/strong\u003eIt was avoided with hours to spare. Biden signed a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/congress-moves-to-avert-partial-government-shutdown-8f5b5b0c6c4cb12af8316ffc0b098771?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estopgap spending bill\u003c/a\u003e that extends government spending through Dec. 3, when Congress will have to figure out another short- or long-term solution. This bill also includes billions of dollars for Afghan refugee resettlement and aid for communities hit by recent hurricanes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDebt ceiling: \u003c/strong\u003eCongress has until Oct. 18 to suspend or raise the debt ceiling before the US begins defaulting on its loans, an outcome that would likely be catastrophic for the economy. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is planning a vote on the debt ceiling as soon as \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-30/schumer-escalates-pressure-on-debt-limit-plans-vote-next-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enext week\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor her part, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen never wants to hear the word “debt ceiling” again—yesterday she told lawmakers the US should abolish the concept of a borrowing limit. Or maybe she could just \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/24/the-legend-of-the-usd1-trillion-platinum-coin?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emint the coin\u003c/a\u003e?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInfrastructure: \u003c/strong\u003ehold in case of vote\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$3.5 trillion spending bill: \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s stuck in the mud as Democrats have struggled to round up support for their package that would pour unprecedented sums into health care, education, and climate. Republicans oppose the plan due to the cost...but the bigger issue is winning over some centrist Democrats, who are also holding out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSen. Joe Manchin said yesterday his top-line cost for the plan would be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/30/politics/manchin-bipartisan-infrastructure-deal-vote-negotiations/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.5 trillion\u003c/a\u003e, less than half of the original price tag. Without the entire party rallying behind it, the package can’t pass the Senate, where the Dems have the slimmest of majorities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/government-shutdown-averted-but-big-battles-loom-for-biden-s-agenda\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/29b4b2e449c9d18134236c54d220ef2a79e7ab84-1024x708.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e21 current and former employees of Jeff Bezos’s space company, Blue Origin, published an \u003ca href=\"https://www.lioness.co/post/bezos-wants-to-create-a-better-future-in-space-his-company-blue-origin-is-stuck-in-a-toxic-past?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen letter\u003c/a\u003e on Thursday describing it as a “toxic” workplace “rife with sexism.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpearheaded by Blue Origin’s former head of employee communications, Alexandra Abrams, the letter alleges that the company is dismissive of safety concerns, creates a sexist environment for female employees, and stifles professional dissent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe signatories allege that an executive who was repeatedly reported for sexual harassment was given a position on a hiring committee for an HR role. They also wrote that another former male executive would inquire about female employees’ dating lives, referring to them as “baby doll” or “baby girl.” The behavior was so well known, the letter claims, that some women at the company would warn new female hires to stay away from the executive (who, according to the letter, had a close personal relationship with Jeff Bezos).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response to the allegations, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/30/jeff-bezos-blue-origin-essay-claims-toxic-workplace.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBlue Origin’s VP of communications\u003c/a\u003e stated that Abrams was “dismissed for cause” in 2019, and that “Blue Origin has no tolerance for discrimination or harassment of any kind.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn FAA spokesperson said that the agency will \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/faa-review-safety-concerns-raised-by-former-blue-origin-employee-2021-09-3?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereview the concerns\u003c/a\u003e raised in the letter. —\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/blue-origin-employees-open-letter-toxic-workplace\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; The median national rent for a one-bedroom apartment is up 10.7% from March 2020, while two-bedrooms are up 13%, according to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.zumper.com/blog/rental-price-data/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eZumper National Rent Report\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDouble digit increases are…not common. For context, 2020 rents increased \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rent-prices-increasing-us-cities-zumper-data-2021-9?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1% from the previous year\u003c/a\u003e, and 2019 rents were stagnant compared to 2018. It’s a “shocking level of growth, especially considering the vast majority of it has come in the last nine months,” wrote Jeff Andrews, the author of the report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy the surge? \u003c/strong\u003eTo put it simply, \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rents-increasing-new-york-phoenix-greenwich-single-family-homes-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edemand is back\u003c/a\u003e. Gen Z renters are moving out of their childhood homes after a long pandemic, remote-working millennials are picking apartments in more affordable cities, and baby boomers are offloading their homes in a seller’s market, opting for rentals instead. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePour one out for renters in...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePhoenix, where the one-bedroom median rent increased 24.8% between January and September.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNew York City, style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 70%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the dog days of the
